...

<<ezra>><<ezraSmileTalk>>I’ll find it. I promise.

<<ezra>><<ezraSlyTalk>>No points! 
<<ezra>><<ezraSmileTalkClosed>>What you were supposed to say was ‘Thank you, Ezra! You’re so considerate and smart and I could just kiss you right now!’ 
<<ezra>><<ezraSlyTalk>>anything along those lines would have sufficed. 
<<ambros>><<ambroseAnnoyedTalk>>I’ll thank you when I get my bird.

<<ambros>><<ambroseAnnoyedTalkclosed>>Just don't be late again, okay?
<<hideEzra>>
<<ezraSmile>><<ezra>>I won't.
<<cam1>><<noone>>And with that the door shuts.
<<hideAmbrose>>And they are alone again. 
<<bedroom1>>Ambrose walked back upstairs silently. 
They wrapped themselves in their blankets
and fell asleep.

<<her>><<dream2>><<bedroom1>>A village of wailers.
They know no songs. 
All except one. 
They know how to split the silence with their agony.
They only sing lamentations as they scrubs salts and herbs and roots in their wounds.
Their wounds that refuse to heal. Their boils that drip with greases, their tongues that blister;
All untreated.
Where is that Sangoma?
The one whose hand can heal the injured?
Who splits the bill of pain and takes the larger portions for himself?
Where is he?
Days pass and the villagers lie in the sand. 
Bodies bare of warmth.
Dust in the hollows of their eyes and mouths. 
Birds picking off the hanging bits of skin as something grey oozes out. 
And yet, 
...
..
.
They still wail. 
<<endDream2>>...

<<ambros>>More dreams...
<<noone>>They pull the sheets from off themselves and begins their day.
...
It went by as it usually does. 
<<tree>>They ate from the tree, 
<<library2>>They read in the library.

Yet, they remained slightly disturbed. 
The dream still ever persistent in their thoughts. 
Those same birds. 
If only they were the sort of person that could forget these dreams so easily.
...
..
.
The door unlocked. 
And those footsteps shuffled towards the living room.[[arrival2]]

body:

<<ezra>><<ezraNervousTalk>>Woah, I never said I hated dreams. I just think they don't matter.
<<ezra>><<ezraNeutralTalk>>I mean, a long time ago most everyone though dreams were important. 
<<ezra>><<ezraAnnoyedTalk>>We'd go to people that claimed to understand our sleeping minds to see the secrets we kepted hidden in ourselves.
<<ezra>><<ezraSmileTalk>>But we got wiser, we were about to peak into the mind with machines of all sorts
<<ezra>><<ezraSmileTalkClosed>>And it stole the mystery that dreams had. 
<<ezra>><<ezraNeutralTalk>>Dreams are nothing more than vivid shadows of the subconscious.
<<ambros>><<ambroseConfusedTalk>>Shadows of the subconscious?
<<ambros>><<ambroseNeutralTalk>>Then there's certainly value in understanding them, ins't there?
<<ezra>><<ezraNeutralTalk>>I'd ignore your dreams if I were you. Especially the disturbing ones. 
<<ezra>><<ezraSideTalk>>No point stewing in negative emotions.

That day Ambrose woke with no nightmares.
Just a wash of something wonderful as they rose from their blankets to great the day.

"Paradise Lost"

under their tongue,
when light shown through their hand he they pressed it against a window.

It was...different.
Ambrose looks upwards. 
But only sees flashes of something float out of their line of sight and glide towards the white windows. 
They turn their gaze towards the figure and gasp. 
<<showBird>>
This bird. They recognised it. 
It was the one they saw in that dream all those days ago.
They'd only managed to glimpse at it for a second but now it stood before them.
Wide opal eyes that blended into the stark white outside the window. 
But that wasn't what made the thing so...uncanny. 
It was the color it brought.
The deepness of it's shade that stood out against anything they'd ever seen. 
Like...the color of....
They couldn't say what the color reminded them of and before they could even think
<<hideBird>>
the bird's wings sprung up from it's side and it flew out of the library through The narrow gap between the door and wall.

<<corridor>>
nothing.

The little droplets of red it left behind. 
The liquid dripping from it's beak. 
It was a trail!
Without hesitation Ambrose follows it down the hallway examining the doors they pass by.  
<<ambros>>Hey bird....whe-where are you? 
<<noone>>The last droplet is found beneath the door of the swan room. 
A pool of something viscous that seems to be seeping from the inside of the room.

Something felt...wrong.

They couldn't understand the dread that gripped them, fluttering their hear like the wings of the bird.
Ambrose takes the door handle pushing it open with damp hands. 
They freeze. 
<<swanroomRed>>

Neck cut open and overflowing with...that color. 
That ominous color.

This stationery state the swans were now in.
A weak sound seems to resonate from the pond. 
A painful sound.
Ambrose walks towards the pond, their hands pressed against the glass. 
<<ambros>>H-h-hello...

Black eyes void of nothing. 
Nothing but pain.

Then they sank away.
Slowly disappearing into the murkiness.

Is it sinking in?
It's over.
It's been over for a while now. Everyone pack up, turned off the lights and left.
The labs in District5 are desolate. 
The sick have only gotten sicker and even sleep isn't soothing their pain anymore.
And now you're telling me that the thing you've huddled up with is breaking too?
I'm reading the signs, Ezra. We've lost. 
We've done a hell of a job holding back the inevitable. 
But it's in the name, isn't it?
<<ezra>>G2.02. She of all people must still be around, right? She was in Asparia? She was making promising strides-
<<unknown>>You mean well. At least, I hope you do.
But I'm not in a place where I want to be having this conversation.
In fact, this is probably the last time I'll ever use this phone again. 
<<ezra>>Don't say that.
<<unknown>>I'm tired, Ezra.
I don't understand how you're not but I am. 
I've spent so many lifetimes chasing this dream; so much so I cant remember who I was before this. 
I found paintings over at my brother's place once and asked if he took up the hobby. 
He said they were mine. 
The only way either of us even knew that was because some variant of my signature was scribbled on the corner. 
I can't give everything to this dream. 
I can't give another few 100 years to brainstorming solutions, find one that "just might work", break the bodies of those to desperate to refuse
Then performing an autopsy on the remains as we say, "We were so close this time! Maybe in another few year we'll finally be tangible!". 
It's too much.
It's all too much. 
I want to forget that person entirely. Like I forgot the painter, or writer or martial artist. 
I want my thoughts to be so far removed from her's that we're two different people entirely. 
<<ezra>>The research you were-
<<unknown>>I burnt it.
It's gone. 
I looked through years of notes archived to the t. I really did try, Ezra. But I'm not seeing the light at the end of the tunnel anymore.
We were doomed from the start. 
<<ezra>>How could you be so selfish?
<<ezra>>We're so close to an endless future and you throw everything away to chase some stupid dream? Because you're tired?
You think I don't hate the constant string of failure after failure?
<<ezra>>You think I hadn't thought of that too. 
<<ezra>>Leaving this fucking place, trying to salvage what's left of my life, going to sleep?
<<unknown>>Then why don't you?
<<ezra>>Because it seems like I'm the only one who know I have a responsibility to this world and it's people 
<<ezra>>and that somewhere in the universe there's a cure to this sickness, as there was for polio, cancer, briditis.
<<ezra>>That's why I've held on for so long. 
We've come to far to throw in the towel and quit. You took an oath dammit! 
<<unknown>>That's not it. 
<<ezra>>Really? Then tell me, what's the reason? Since you're at the peak of enlightment? What my problem?
<<unknown>>I won't do that. That's something for you to figure out. 
<<ezra>>Jesus Christ, when did you become so cryptic?
Is this a bit to piss me off or are you finally losing it?
<<unknown>>I wonder how the bright, optimistic man I met all those eons ago would have felt about you now?
A bitter shell of what he once was clambering to the only dream he's ever had. 
Knowing deep down no amount of grabbing and pulling and grasping will ever make it tangible. 
That the human soul and all its constructs will remain obscure to him for what's left of his days. 
<<ezra>>Fuck you. 
<<unknown>>Maybe he'd sympathize. See that deep down these outburst are nothing more than a wounded animals cry as it lies limp in the forest,
bleating out to anyone that might hear it, wanting for the only thing it knows will cure it's pain.
<<ezra>>Shut up!
<<unknown>>Deep down, you know the truth. 
You want to die just as much as I do. 
<<ezra>>You're a fucking coward. 
<<ezra>>You hear me? You're a fucking coward! Fuck you!

title: breaker
body:
<<hideHer>><<hideAmbrose>><<hideEzra>><<blackSnow>><<dark1>>
It was a labyrinth.
Large walls that stretched into the darkness with no end in sight. 
Paths that lead nowhere. 
Grade staircases leading to balconies that overlooked nothing. 
Windows that held no light from the outside and that showed nothing either. 
<<dark2>>
What was this place? 
Ambrose opened his mouth several times. 
Maybe they wanted to ask that exact question. 
But they shut it before words could escape and continued trekking. 
Maybe they got a sense that their 'sister' would not answer them. 
Who could've known.
Ambrose stretched their hand out into the darkness and watched them disappear the further they drifted from them. 
If not for the iridescent glow of the bird they would surely be swallowed by the walls of this place.
Or the pits. 
Then without warn the bird fell to the ground as though it was struck by something. 
!!! 
Ambrose dropped down towards the creature. 
<<ambros>>Are you alright?
What's-what's wrong?
<<her>>He struck me down again! 
He crushed me beneath his both!
My skull...I felt it implode under his weight! 
<<ambros>>I...I don't know what any of that means...
<<her>>Roll up your sleeve and feed me so I might replenish my strength. 
I beg, Sleeper. 
<<noone>>Ambrose does just that and the bird sinks it's little needle into their skin. 
<<ambros>>Why do you call me that? Sleeper, I mean.
<<noone>>The bird raised it's needle out of the skin and stares up at them. 
<<her>>Because...that is all I've known you as. 
Her, the creeper. Everywhere all at once.
Clinging to all things. 
weighing them down like fruit in autumn.
Me, the reaper. ending the things that are to broken to continue going on. 
Rendering them null. 
And you, the sleeper. Dulling the pain the comes with ending. 
Singing to them sweetly till they forget sorrow and suffering. 
That is who we are together. 
<<ambros>>I don't remember any of that.
<<her>>I am replenished now. 
I will lead you the rest of the way. 
<<noone>>The bird jumps out of their hands and scurries along in the darkness. 
They walked for a long time. 
Ambrose feet growing ever weary as they marched onwards. 
But just as Ambrose was about to collapse within the darkness and sleep on the cold, stone floor...
There was a light in the distance. 
A pale color illuminated the hallway.
And even more than that...
there was a voice. 
It was barely audible. 
It was hard to make out any words. 
But...it was
<<ambros>>Ezra? 
<<her>>Be silent. Walk slowly towards the light. 
<<noone>>Ambrose bit their tongue and nodded shuffling ever so slightly towards the light. 
Soon enough they were able to see what it was.
<<doorRed>>
A little room with a glass door slightly ajar. 
The words became clearer too. 
It was Ezra. 
He was in another one of those booths. Phone pressed to his ear. 
Who was it he was speaking to?
The same woman from before?
<<her>>Listen...
...
..
.
<<ezra1>>They're everywhere. 
I've found as many as I could but they keep...multiplying. 
I know...I'm the last person you want to hear from right now but I need you. 
Everything's falling apart here. 
...
..
.
<<ezra1>>I can't go back there. I don't know what to say to them. 
I'm not sure I can keep lying to them. 
I don't have it in me anymore. 
<<unknown>>You're tired...aren't you. 
<<ezra1>>Don't say it like that. 
<<unknown>>What do you mean?
<<ezra1>>I'm not an idiot. I know what you mean when you use that word. 
It...it;s not the same way you are. 
I just need some more time. 
<<unknown>>You're no closer to find a cure for decay than you were all those years ago when we first started this project. 
Nothing's changed since then. You've-
<<ezra1>>They're in a stable condition, aren't they? 
They're better. 
<<unknown>>They're?
...
..
.
I wanted to ask you this when we last talked. 
It's been bugging me. 
I've spent years thinking about it actually. 
...
You're not attached to that thing...are you? 
...
..
.
<<ezra1>>They aren't a thing. They're a patient, just like all the others. 
<<unknown>>You know that's not true. 
That things the reason we started this whole damn project in the first place. 
It's not a person, Ez. It's the devil!
It's death incarnate!
<<noone>>Ambros clambers back. 
A shudder runs down their spine as the hold a hand over their mouth. 
<<unknown>>You know this. Don't you?
Tell me you know this. 
<<ezra1>>I know...
<<unknown>>I hope you do. 
I'm not trying to make you feel bad. I just need to know that you know this-
<<ezra1>>I do! Okay. Now can you just get on with it!
What do I need to do to keep this whole damn project from falling apart. 
<<unknown>>Come on. You and I both know what I'm about to say, right? 
If you were Dallas or Kian I'd by this whole blockhead shit. 
But that's not who yo are, is it? 
You've alread called me four times and I told yah the same thing.
You've only got two options here.
<<ezra1>>No...there has to be another way.
<<unknown>>There isn't.
Find a new vessel or 
give up like everyone else did. 
That's it. 
<<ezra1>>Where would I even get a new vessel?
<<unknown>>Go down to Quarter 9. They've been breeding some birds for a while now. 
Use one of those. 
And this time...keep it in a cage.
Not that little condo you've built.
<<ezra1>>You know just as well as I do that keeping them in a clean, cosy environment produced better results that what they were doing before.
Less outburst, less prone to illness. 
All that prevented the sickness from spreading further out of the complex.
We can't go back to what those occultists were doing. 
<<unknown>>They kept death at bay for eons. 
We haven't even achieved half of that. 
And I'm not suggesting just any run of the mill cage. 
I sent you the plans didn't I? 
What do you think?
<<ezra1>>It's...it's restrictive or motion. If we put anything in there it's bound to be panicked. 
Panic isn't the reaction we want. 
<<unknown>>You didn't read it in full, did you?
Go over to page four. 
...
..
.
Do you see that? 
The vibrations paired with the frequency will induce a comatose state. 
The figures may have to be adjusted depending on the size and species of the new vessel but outside of that it's a good holding place till we come up with a final solution. 
We just gotta paint the inner walls white and that's it. 
You like?
<<ezra1>>I thought you said we weren't interested in trying to help and now you're drawing up plans? 
<<unknown>>It's damned if you do damned if you don't with you, isn't it?
It's been what? Like a century and a half since we last spoke!?
I'm allowed to change my mind about things. 
As are you.
You should be thanking me now. 
I've found a way to prolong our existence a little longer. 
That's what you wanted...isn't it?
<<ezra1>>I-I....
I have to think about it, okay.
<<noone>>Ambrose pulls away from the glass. A tear runs down their cheek.
<<unknown>>Remember who we're doing this for.
This is bigger than you, me or the subject.
We've conquered death...
Now we must conquer decay. 
<<her>>Sleeper, we need to go....
<<noone>>The bird nudges at them by the stay still, staring through the window. 
Unable to move. 
<<ezra1>>You've given me a lot to think about. 
I'll get back to you as soon as I can, alright...
<<her>>Sleeper, now!
We need to go now!
<<noone>>As the words are spoken Ambrose feels something drip on their shoulder. 
It runs down the length of their arm. 
A viscous fluid...
Ambrose looks behind them.
<<monster>>
!!!
They scream.
The red thing inches forward as Ambrose pulls themselves off the ground and scampers away into the darkness. 
<<doorRed2>>
There were more of them surrounding the door. 
Where did they come from?
Yet, that didn't scare them nearly as much as the next thing they heard. 
The shuffle of footsteps.
The click of the latch on the door. 
And his voice breaking the silence. 
<<ezra1>>Ambrose...
Is that you?
They wouldn't make the same mistake. 
Not this time.
...
..
.
Ambrose run away.

title: I hate you
body:
<<ezra>>I honestly don't know what to say.
<<ambros>>...
<<ezra>>I never wanted you to see me like that...it...must have been insane to you. 
<<ambros>>...
<<ezra>>I'm sorry, I scared you like that. I just hope it...doesn't change anything. 
<<ambros>>...
<<ezra>>What am I saying.
<<ezra>>Of course it changes everything. That's why I stayed away for so long. I didn't want to confront you.
<<ezra>>Confront...this!
<<ezra>>I know it was selfish me...
<<ezra>>Ambros, please...
<<ezra>>Please speak to me. 
<<ezra>>Please. 
<<ambros>>What am I?
<<ezra>>I...what do you mean?
<<ambros>>The person on the other end of the line, they called me an "it". 
<<ambros>>Why?
<<ezra>>...
<<ezra>>Well...
<<ezra>>We weren't talking about you-
<<ambros>>You're lying. 
<<ezra>>I know it might, maybe have seemed that why but that whole conversation was never about you. 
<<ambros>>"They're getting paler.", "They're hallucinating." Those all weren't about me?
<<ezra>>There are many other subjects-
<<ambros>>So that's why I am then, a subject?
<<ezra>>I meant patients and your condition isn't uncommon? 
<<ezra>>It's an epidemic at this point. 
<<ezra>>Ambros, it had nothing to do with you. I promise.
<<ambros>>Okay.
<<ambros>>What are condolences?
<<ezra>>Ambros.
<<ambros>>I'm just asking questions. I want to understand what I saw back there. 
<<ezra>>That-
<<ambros>>We're together now aren't we? So shouldn't we trust each other. 
<<ezra>>Yes...but there's somethings that I can't relay. Confidential matters that might get me suspended or even fired. 
<<ambros>>From what? Everyone's gone.
<<ezra>>...
<<ambros>>"The labs are desolate", that's what they said, right?
<<ambros>>So what have you been doing all this time, then? 
<<ezra>>How much did you hear of that conversation?
<<ambros>>Enough to understand that I'm being lied to. That something's terribly wrong here.

<<ezra>>Maybe we should talk about this some other time.
<<ambros>>...
<<ambros>>Fine. 
<<ezra>>Where are you going?
<<ezra>>What are you doing?!
<<ambros>>I'm leaving.
<<ezra>>Y-you're overreacting. 
<<ambros>> I just found out the only person I've ever trusted has been lying to me for what?
<<ambros>>Days? I don't even know how long?
<<ambros>>And he won't give me a straight answer. 
<<ezra>>Ambros! Stop it!
<<ambros>>So I'll find out for myself.
<<ezra>>Please Ambros, you have to believe that everything I'm doing is for you own good. 
<<ambros>>Why should I believe a single thing you say. 
<<ambros>>Ezra, if you told me the sky was red I would have believed you. 
<<ambros>>I trusted you more than I trusted myself. 
<<ambros>>And now after all of this...I don't know what to think. 
<<ezra>>Ambros-
<<ambros>>I want to pretend that I didn't hear that conversation.
<<ambros>>I want to go back to that day when you made the swan room or the day after.
<<ambros>>It hurts me thinking about it...
<<ambros>>How ontop of all the betrayal, ontop of lying to me....you may never have wanted to be here in the first place. <<ezra>>I do. I want to be here with you. That's all I want. 
<<ambros>>What does sleeping mean?
<<ezra>>...
<<ambros>>What did you mean when you said that you'd thought about sleeping? 
<<ezra>>...
<<ambros>>That's what I thought. 
<<ezra>>Stop.
<<ambros>>Get your hands off me!
<<ezra>>I'm sorry, but-
<<ambros>>Are you going to break me too.
<<ezra>>Why would you say that. 
<<ezra>>I would never hurt you...
<<ambros>>I don't know who you are!
<<ezra>>I'm the same Ezra, I've always been. The same person you've know for all these eons.
<<ambros>>Eons? 
<<ambros>>What are those?
<<ezra>>I-
<<ambros>>Open the door. I want to get out of here! 
<<ambros>>This is my apartment, right? I'm here of my own free will? Then open the door! Open it!
<<ezra>>I can't...
<<ambros>>You can't or you won't...which is it?!!
<<ezra>>I'm sorry Ambrose, but I can't let you leave. I just can't.
<<ambros>>...
<<ambros>>I hate you.

title: day7
body:
<<showAmbrose>>
<<ShowEzra>>
<<ambros>><<ambroseShocked>>You're kidding, right?
<<ezra>><<ezraNervous>>What?
<<ambros>><<ambroseEyebrowTalk>>That's all your stuff?
<<ezra>><<ezraNervousTalk>>It's called minimalism. 
<<ezraConcernedTalk>>After all, I travel a tonne so it's be exhausting if I had too many things.
<<ambros>><<ambroseSlyTalk>>I just expected you'd have way more interesting stuff since you're always talking about all the cool things you've seen.
<<ambrosEyesClosedTalk>>But I guess seeing interesting things doesn't necessarily mean you become interesting. 
<<ezra>><<ezraAnnoyedTalk>>You know, a wise man once said "You don't have to say everything you think, Ambros".
<<ambros>><<ambroseEyebrowTalk>>Was the wise man addressing me specifically or are you the wise man?
<<ezra>><<ezraTiredTalk>>Give me a break, it took me forever to hike up those stairs.
<<ambros>><<AmbroseSmileTalkClose>>Okay, okay. I'll be good.
<<noone>>Ambrose grips the handle of the suitcase.
<<ambros>><<ambroseSmileTalk>>Where's your room at? I'll take your-
<<ezra>><<ezraPanicTalk>>Don't worry about it!
<<ambros>><<ambroseShocked>>...
<<ezra>><<ezraNervousTalk>>I mean, I'm tired but I can handle a little bit of a walk. 
<<ezraNeutralTalk>>Why don't you wait in the livingroom and I'll be back in a few. 
<<ambros>><<ambroseSurprised>>Oh... 
<<ambroseSmileClose>>Okay!
<<ambroseSmileTalk>>Don't take too long.
<<noone>>Ambrose watches as Ezra creeps away behind a shadowy corner. 
<<ambros>>...
Oh well.
<<noone>>The day past in brief blurs. Ambros waited on the sofa for what felt like ages. Ezra did not emerge. 
As Ambros fell asleep on the couch the soft padding of footsteps had them stir slightly.
Not enough to break their slumber but enough that they felt their skin prickle. 
A flutter of goosebumps clustered under Ambrose's clothes as they felt a shadow obscure the white light filtering through
bright windows. 
Some dread captured them and they sprung from their peaceful position. 
<<ambros>>Oh!
<<ezra>>What's wrong?
<<ambros>>You scared me for a second. I never expect to see you at this time.
You're usually gone by now. 
<<ezra>>I'm sorry. I wanted to scoop you up and take you to your bed room but I didn't count on you being such a light sleeper.
<<ambros>>I guess it'll take sometime to get used to seeing you around past a certain point. 
<<ezra>>I could always hide in my room until it's brighter.
<<ambros>>Then it'd be just as good as you not being here, wouldn't it?
I didn't agree to you moving in so I could see you the exact amount of time as before you moved in.
<<ezra>>That's a good point. I guess you'll just have to suck it up and stop being a scaredy cat. 
<<ambros>>Or you could stop creeping around and invest in quieter shoes. 
<<ezra>>ha!
<<ambros>>What's so funny?
<<ezra>>Nothing, I was just thinking about the first time we met.
Remember how you threw that shoe at me when I tried to give you food but the shoe didn't even make it past the end of the bed?
<<ambros>>What about it? Are you looking for round 2 or something. 
<<ezra>>I don't know. I never would've thought that we'd be so close back then. 
You hated me I think. 
And now look at us? Living in the same house and you've only threatened me once today. 
I think that's progress. 
<<ambros>>The things you get nostalgic over. 
<<noone>>Ambrose looks up at the ceiling and the little lights that sparkled above them.
<<ambros>>To be honest I don't remember much of any of that. 
I guess I was so sick back then that most of those days were nothing more than a blur. 
<<ezra>>Yah, I suppose so. 
<<ambros>>But, I don't think I hated you.
I don't remember the events but the feelings are still vivid to me. 
I felt trapped I think. Maybe because of my body or this illness. Or something...
I was probably just lashing out, I'm sorry-
<<ezra>>You don't ever need to apologize to me, Ambrose. 
After all, it's not like the shoe even hit me. 
None of it was your fault. 
<<ambros>>Okay. 
<<noone>>The room darkens as the world slowly drifts into night. 
The pair lie on the couch as a weariness takes hold of them. 
<<ambros>>You know, you can scoop me up and take me to my room now if you like?
<<ezra>>Yah, it's more of a romantic gesture when you don't ask for it. Just let it happen. 
<<ambros>>You may never get an opportunity like this again.
I'm very good about going to my room when I tired so you might as well do it now. 
Scoop me!
<<ezra>>Alright, alright. let's go. 
<<noone>>Ezra stands up then hoist Ambrose over his shoulder with both arms. 
<<ambros>>This isn't remotely what I had in mind. 
<<ezra>>You're getting a free ride to your room Ambrose, don't be picky about the mode of transport. 
They make their way up the stares and into Ambrose's bedroom. 
Then the door is shut behind them.

title: day8
body:
<<noone>>Something crashes to the ground. 
It's resonates through the little apartment echoing against walls and windows. 
And yet, the sound was for no else but Ambrose to hear. 
They pull themselves from Ezra's warmth. 
Black eyes pierce the white as they sit up. 
Where did that sound come from?

That owl that sat upright atop the shelf was dashed against the floor. 
It had fallen many times before this but today it had decided of it own accord that it would shatter. 
In it's untimely pursuit to fragment itself it birthed many shards. 
Jagged teeth that shown tenderly against the bright, white light. 
Snagged little teeth that welcomed a virgin hand as it reached out to examine the pieces. 
Then came another sound.
It too resonated through the apartment and echoed against walls and windows. 
But this one was for Ezra.

<<ezra>>Ambrose! What's wrong? 
Your hand...

<<ezra>>You're such a clutz sometimes. 
How'd you manage to break something like that? 
<<ambros>>It just fell out of nowhere. It falls all the time but I guess it wasn't strong enough this time.
...
<<ezra>>Ambrose?
Ambrose, are you alright?
<<ambros>>What does that mean? 
<<ezra>>What?
...
<<ambros>>Never mind. 
<<ezra>>There, your hands all patched up. I'm going to clean up the owl.
<<ambros>>Okay.
Hey, would you like me to get a new one? There's plenty in stock so I could get one that's exactly the same as the last one. 
<<ambros>>No.
It's gone now.
<<ezra>>I could always patch it up with some glue if you feel bad about replacing it.
<<ambros>>It's fine, Ezra. We should let it rest. 
...
<<ezra>>It's a shame. You really liked that little guy.
<<noone>>It was an uneventful day. 
One that played out like the millions of other days before that one. 
They talked together, laughed together and watched as time inevitably stole another bright day. 
Then came the golden day. with it's shimmering light that slumped itself upon everything like some fine gloss. 
And with this, came the desire to sleep once again. 
So, the two parted and Ambrose returned to his chamber
and fell asleep. 

Something shuffled in the sheets.
It was small enough that Ambrose could cup the thing in their hands if they wanted to. 
But they don't.
Instead, they clamber back, taken by the little moving thing. 
A hand reaches for the door knob turning it slightly but before they can the sheet falls off revealing the thing. 
It's fluffy feathers. It's big eyes. It's tiny, needle beak. 
It was a bird of some sort. A little bird the color of Ambrose's wound. 
A beautiful shade of it.
There's some resistance now. 
Something tugs Ambrose towards the door.
But the big, black eyes of the bird pulled ambrose towards it. 

It chirps. 
A pretty little chirp. 
How can anyone be afraid of such a thing?
Trembling fingers drift towards the thing. 
It trots forward speedily till it's little legs are in Ambrose's hand. 
<<ambros>>You're not so bad, are you? 
<<noone>>A second hand rises from they're side and begins to stroke the thing. 
<<ambros>>What sort of bird are you? A swan chick? or...
...
The other bird?
You're nothing like that other bird though.
<<noone>>It jumps out of their hand and waddles towards the pillow.
It lowers it's head till it's nothing more than a fluffy ball and it's black eyes close. 
<<ambros>>I'm tired too.
I guess you can sleep here with me. 
My allergies don't seem to be flaring up anyway so there shouldn't be a problem.
Goodnight. 
...
..
.
<<her>>Goodnight.

title: day9
body:
<<bedroom2>><<noone>>From the moment that bird started visiting their nightmares faded. 
Each night it would find its way into the bed and nuzzle up to Ambrose. 
It's fuzzy body glowing a color they'd never seen before. 
A beautiful color. 
...
..
.
Sometimes, as they faded in unconsciousness, the little bird would hope on his wrist. 
It would bury itself in the cotton.
And there would be this pain. 
Nothing distracting or overwhelming. 
It was mild...
Ticklish even.
Then it would pull itself out of their shirt and scurry away
slipping into the shadows taking the nightmares with it.
And leaving nothing more than a little dot in the skin. 
The cost of taking dreams away Ambrose supposed.
They wanted to ask Ezra about that bird. 
They couldn't find anything about it in the book but maybe a description of it's habits would be helpful.
But when the sat beside him, ready to share this secret....
They remembered the other bird...
The vivid daydream that panicked them that day...
So they talk about something else instead. 
If only there was a way to prove to him this thing existed. 
If only...
...
..
.
As the trek up the stairs and drag themselves into the bedroom, they freeze. 
There it is. 
Sleeping on the bed. 
It's earlier than it's ever been.
As Ambrose makes their way to the bed they stop in their tracks. 
They had an idea!
<<ambros>>Hey, Ezra! Get in here!
<<noone>>There was a shuffle of footsteps as he made his way to the bedroom.
<<ezra>>This better be important! I was in the middle of-
<<ambros>>Well, well, well. Look who's crazy now?
<<ezra>>Is that-
...
<<ambros>>I told you there was a bird in here! 
Not the same bird from before sure...but a bird nonetheless.
Isn't she cute?
Well, I'm not sure if she's a she or not. I'm still learning a tonne about birds.
<<ezra>>...
<<ambros>>You'd probably be able to help with that, right?
Hey, why aren't you-
<<noone>>It's a swift motion.
One moment Ezra was in front of Ambrose and the next moment he'd lunged forward towards the bird and scooped it in his hand. 
High pitched screams penetrated the silence and the little thing chirped out, afraid. 
<<ambros>>What are you doing!?!
<<ezra>>I'm sorry I didn't believe you, Ambrose. But I have to get rid of this thing.
It isn't safe. 
<<ambros>>What do you mean? It's been here for a few days and I've been fine!
No flare ups or anything.
She won't hurt me. 
Now let go of her.
<<ezra>>It's more complex than that. I have to get rid of it. 
<<noone>>Ezra turns to leave the room as the bird stares out at Ambrose. 
It's eyes round with fear and it chirps frantically. 
<<ambros>>Stop it! Y-you're hurting her!
<<ezra>>I'll release it back into the wild where-
<<noone>>But before he could complete that statement Ambrose clung to Ezra's balled fist as he struggled to unravel his fingers.
<<ambros>>I said let go! 
<<ezra>>This is for your own good, Ambros...
<<ambros>>Why is it always you that gets to decide that!
